content: Country in the Malay Peninsula in Southeast Asia The following [outline](/wiki/Outline_(list)) is provided as an overview and topical guide to Singapore: **[Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)** – a [sovereign](/wiki/List_of_sovereign_states) [republic](/wiki/Republic) comprising the main island of Singapore and smaller outlying islands which are located at the southern tip of the [Malay Peninsula](/wiki/Malay_Peninsula) in [Southeast Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia). Singapore lies 137 kilometres (85 mi) north of the [equator](/wiki/Equator), south of the [Malaysian](/wiki/Malaysia) state of [Johor](/wiki/Johor) and north of [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia)'s [Riau Islands](/wiki/Riau_Islands) and is in-between the [Straits of Malacca](/wiki/Straits_of_Malacca) and the [South China Sea](/wiki/South_China_Sea). Singapore is one of the three [city-states](/wiki/City-state) in the world, along with [Monaco](/wiki/Monaco) and the [Vatican City](/wiki/Vatican_City), and is the only one with full self-governance, its own currency, and a significant military force; *[The Economist](/wiki/The_Economist)* refers to Singapore as the "world's only fully functioning city-state". It is the second smallest nation in [Asia](/wiki/Asia) by land area, ahead of [Maldives](/wiki/Maldives) and similar to [Bahrain](/wiki/Bahrain). ## General reference - [Pronunciation](/wiki/International_Phonetic_Alphabet): /ˈsɪŋəpɔːr/ or /ˈsɪŋɡəpɔːr/ - Common English country name: [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) - Official English country name: The [Republic of Singapore](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore) - Official [endonyms](/wiki/Exonym_and_endonym): [Singapore](/wiki/List_of_countries_and_capitals_in_native_languages#S) (English), *Singapura* ([Malay](/wiki/Malay_language)), 新加坡 ([Pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Xīnjiāpō*, [Mandarin](/wiki/Standard_Mandarin)), சிங்கப்பூர் (*Ciŋkappūr*, [Tamil](/wiki/Tamil_language)) - Common endonyms: Lion City, [Little red dot](/wiki/Little_red_dot), [Temasek](/wiki/Temasek) - [Adjectival](/wiki/List_of_adjectival_and_demonymic_forms_for_countries_and_nations)(s): [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) - [Demonym](/wiki/List_of_adjectival_and_demonymic_forms_of_place_names#Countries_and_nations)(s): [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) - [Etymology](/wiki/Etymology): [Name of Singapore](/wiki/Name_of_Singapore) - [International rankings of Singapore](/wiki/International_rankings_of_Singapore) - [ISO country codes](/wiki/ISO_country_codes): SG, SGP, 702 - [ISO region codes](/wiki/ISO_region_codes): See ISO 3166-2:SG - [Internet](/wiki/Internet) [country code top-level domain](/wiki/Country_code_top-level_domain): [.sg](/wiki/.sg) - [Internationalised country code top-level domains](/wiki/Internationalized_country_code_top-level_domain): .新加坡 (encoded as .xn—yfro4i67o) and .சிங்கப்பூர் (encoded as .xn—clchc0ea0b2g2a9gcd) ## Geography of Singapore - Singapore is: an [island country](/wiki/Island_country) made up of [63 islands](/wiki/List_of_islands_of_Singapore) - Location: - [Northern Hemisphere](/wiki/Northern_Hemisphere) and [Eastern Hemisphere](/wiki/Eastern_Hemisphere) - [Eurasia](/wiki/Eurasia) - [Asia](/wiki/Asia) - [Southeast Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia) - [Indochina](/wiki/Indochina) - [Maritime Southeast Asia](/wiki/Maritime_Southeast_Asia) - [Time zone](/wiki/Time_zone): [Singapore Standard Time](/wiki/Singapore_Standard_Time) = [ASEAN Common Time](/wiki/ASEAN_Common_Time) ([UTC+08](/wiki/UTC%2B08)) - [Extreme points of Singapore](/wiki/Extreme_points_of_Singapore): - High: [Bukit Timah](/wiki/Bukit_Timah) 163.63 m (537 ft) - Low: [Singapore Strait](/wiki/Singapore_Strait) 0 m - Land boundaries: *none* (two causeways to [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia)) - Coastline: 193 km (120 mi) - [Population of Singapore](/wiki/Demographics_of_Singapore#Population_size_and_growth_by_residential_status): 5,685,807 (2020) - Area of Singapore: 728.1 km2 (281.1 sq mi) - Atlas of Singapore ### Environment of Singapore - [Astronomical phenomena](/wiki/Astronomy) - Next total [solar eclipse](/wiki/Solar_eclipse) visible in Singapore: 5 July 2168 - [Biosphere reserves in Singapore](/wiki/Biosphere_reserves_in_Singapore) - [Climate of Singapore](/wiki/Climate_of_Singapore) - [Environmental issues in Singapore](/wiki/Environmental_issues_in_Singapore) - [Geology of Singapore](/wiki/Geology_of_Singapore) - [Wildlife of Singapore](/wiki/Wildlife_of_Singapore) - [Flora of Singapore](/wiki/Flora_of_Singapore) - [Fauna of Singapore](/wiki/Fauna_of_Singapore) - [Birds of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_birds_of_Singapore) - [Mammals of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_mammals_of_Singapore) #### Natural geographic features of Singapore - Hills of Singapore - [Islands of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_islands_of_Singapore) - [Lakes of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_lakes_in_Singapore) - [Rivers of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_rivers_of_Singapore) ### Regions of Singapore #### Administrative divisions of Singapore ##### Municipalities - Being a [city-state](/wiki/City-state), Singapore is both a [city](/wiki/City) and a [nation state](/wiki/Nation_state) - Singapore is its own only municipality - [Capital](/wiki/Capital_(political)) of Singapore: Singapore is its own capital ### Demography of Singapore ## Government and politics of Singapore - [Form of government](/wiki/Form_of_government): [Unitary state](/wiki/Unitary_state) under a [Parliamentary democracy](/wiki/Parliamentary_democracy) - [Elections in Singapore](/wiki/Elections_in_Singapore) - [Political parties in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_political_parties_in_Singapore) - [Taxation in Singapore](/wiki/Taxation_in_Singapore) ### Branches of the government of Singapore #### Executive branch of the government of Singapore - [Head of state](/wiki/Head_of_state): [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore), [Tharman Shanmugaratnam](/wiki/Tharman_Shanmugaratnam) - [Head of government](/wiki/Head_of_government): [Prime Minister of Singapore](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore), [Lawrence Wong](/wiki/Lawrence_Wong) - [Cabinet of Singapore](/wiki/Cabinet_of_Singapore) #### Legislative branch of the government of Singapore - [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) ([unicameral](/wiki/Unicameral)) #### Judicial branch of the government of Singapore - [Judicial officers of the Republic of Singapore](/wiki/Judicial_officers_of_the_Republic_of_Singapore) - [Supreme Court of Singapore](/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_Singapore) - [Subordinate Courts of Singapore](/wiki/Subordinate_Courts_of_Singapore) ### Foreign relations of Singapore - [Diplomatic missions in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_diplomatic_missions_in_Singapore) - [Diplomatic missions of Singapore](/wiki/Diplomatic_missions_of_Singapore) - [Malaysia-Singapore relations](/wiki/Malaysia-Singapore_relations) - [Singapore – United States relations](/wiki/Singapore_%E2%80%93_United_States_relations) #### International organisation membership The Republic of Singapore is a member of the: - [Asian Development Bank](/wiki/Asian_Development_Bank) (ADB) - [Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation](/wiki/Asia-Pacific_Economic_Cooperation) (APEC) - [Asia-Pacific Telecommunity](/wiki/Asia-Pacific_Telecommunity) (APT) - [Association of Southeast Asian Nations](/wiki/Association_of_Southeast_Asian_Nations) (ASEAN) - [Association of Southeast Asian Nations Regional Forum](/wiki/Association_of_Southeast_Asian_Nations_Regional_Forum) (ARF) - [Bank for International Settlements](/wiki/Bank_for_International_Settlements) (BIS) - [Colombo Plan](/wiki/Colombo_Plan) (CP) - [Commonwealth of Nations](/wiki/Commonwealth_of_Nations) - [East Asia Summit](/wiki/East_Asia_Summit) (EAS) - [Group of 77](/wiki/Group_of_77) (G77) - [International Atomic Energy Agency](/wiki/International_Atomic_Energy_Agency) (IAEA) - [International Bank for Reconstruction and Development](/wiki/International_Bank_for_Reconstruction_and_Development) (IBRD) - [International Chamber of Commerce](/wiki/International_Chamber_of_Commerce) (ICC) - [International Civil Aviation Organization](/wiki/International_Civil_Aviation_Organization) (ICAO) - [International Criminal Police Organization](/wiki/International_Criminal_Police_Organization) (Interpol) - [International Development Association](/wiki/International_Development_Association) (IDA) - [International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies](/wiki/International_Federation_of_Red_Cross_and_Red_Crescent_Societies) (IFRCS) - [International Finance Corporation](/wiki/International_Finance_Corporation) (IFC) - [International Hydrographic Organization](/wiki/International_Hydrographic_Organization) (IHO) - [International Labour Organization](/wiki/International_Labour_Organization) (ILO) - [International Maritime Organization](/wiki/International_Maritime_Organization) (IMO) - [International Mobile Satellite Organization](/wiki/International_Mobile_Satellite_Organization) (IMSO) - [International Monetary Fund](/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund) (IMF) - [International Olympic Committee](/wiki/International_Olympic_Committee) (IOC) - [International Organization for Standardization](/wiki/International_Organization_for_Standardization) (ISO) - [International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement](/wiki/International_Red_Cross_and_Red_Crescent_Movement) (ICRM) - [International Telecommunication Union](/wiki/International_Telecommunication_Union) (ITU) - [International Telecommunications Satellite Organization](/wiki/International_Telecommunications_Satellite_Organization) (ITSO) - [International Trade Union Confederation](/wiki/International_Trade_Union_Confederation) (ITUC) - [Inter-Parliamentary Union](/wiki/Inter-Parliamentary_Union) (IPU) - [Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency](/wiki/Multilateral_Investment_Guarantee_Agency) (MIGA) - [Nonaligned Movement](/wiki/Nonaligned_Movement) (NAM) - [Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons](/wiki/Organisation_for_the_Prohibition_of_Chemical_Weapons) (OPCW) - [Pacific Economic Cooperation Council](/wiki/Pacific_Economic_Cooperation_Council) (PECC) - [Permanent Court of Arbitration](/wiki/Permanent_Court_of_Arbitration) (PCA) - [Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership](/wiki/Regional_Comprehensive_Economic_Partnership) (RCEP) - [United Nations](/wiki/United_Nations) (UN) - [United Nations Conference on Trade and Development](/wiki/United_Nations_Conference_on_Trade_and_Development) (UNCTAD) - [United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization](/wiki/United_Nations_Educational,_Scientific,_and_Cultural_Organization) (UNESCO) - [United Nations Integrated Mission in Timor-Leste](/wiki/United_Nations_Integrated_Mission_in_Timor-Leste) (UNMIT) - [Universal Postal Union](/wiki/Universal_Postal_Union) (UPU) - [World Confederation of Labour](/wiki/World_Confederation_of_Labour) (WCL) - [World Customs Organization](/wiki/World_Customs_Organization) (WCO) - [World Federation of Trade Unions](/wiki/World_Federation_of_Trade_Unions) (WFTU) - [World Health Organization](/wiki/World_Health_Organization) (WHO) - [World Intellectual Property Organization](/wiki/World_Intellectual_Property_Organization) (WIPO) - [World Meteorological Organization](/wiki/World_Meteorological_Organization) (WMO) - [World Trade Organization](/wiki/World_Trade_Organization) (WTO) ### Law and order in Singapore - Army of Singapore: [Singapore Army](/wiki/Singapore_Army) - Navy of Singapore: [Republic of Singapore Navy](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Navy) - Air force of Singapore: [Republic of Singapore Air Force](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Air_Force) - [Military history of Singapore](/wiki/Military_history_of_Singapore) - [Military ranks of Singapore](/wiki/Military_ranks_of_Singapore) ## History of Singapore - [Early history of Singapore](/wiki/Early_history_of_Singapore) (before 1819) - [Founding years of modern Singapore](/wiki/Founding_years_of_modern_Singapore) (1819-1826) - [Singapore in the Straits Settlements](/wiki/Singapore_in_the_Straits_Settlements) (1826–1942) - [Japanese occupation of Singapore](/wiki/Japanese_occupation_of_Singapore) (1942-1945) -
